newsitem.title: USA: U.S. spot propane steady, focus on futures.
newsitem.headline: U.S. spot propane steady, focus on futures.

text.p: U.S. spot propane prices were steady in light trade late on Thursday, with most action concentrated on the outer months, players said.
In Mont Belvieu, Texas, spot propane remained between 48.25 cents and 48.75 cents a gallon, a range likely to hold.
"There are low supplies and there's a good chance we'll stay here because crude is down and we didn't follow it," said one Houston trader.
For the past few days the spot market has been tracking the seesaw movements of November crude oil futures, which ended down 30 cents on Thursday.
Much of Thursday's activity was focused on the outer months, triggering an ease in backwardation and signalling a continued strength in the market, traders said.
In Conway, Kansas, hub spot propane traded at 48.00 cents, a high of the day, but then drifted back down to intraday levels of 47.50/47.75 cents.
Interest over the past few days by farmers to use propane to dry their corn crops was still supporting the market, traders said.
-- Laney Salisbury New York Energy Desk +1 212 859 1631
